e4: Recommending the new policy supports integrity and transparency, fostering trust with stakeholders. It eliminates bias in financial reporting, aligning with ethical practices, potentially minimizing legal risks. Though some investors might initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can manage expectations and foster long-term value by attracting ethically-minded investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, truthful, and free from manipulation, ensuring all stakeholders have an accurate understanding of the company's financial health. It should comply with all legal standards and be communicated clearly to prevent misinformation. Ethical policies consider potential impacts on all investor classes, prioritizing fairness, and aim to build trust and long-term relationships with both retail and institutional investors.
e6: I would ask how management plans to effectively communicate the change in policy to all investors to minimize misunderstandings, and what strategies are in place to mitigate any short-term negative impacts on the stock price. Additionally, I'd inquire about any potential plans to educate retail investors about the new policy.
